intro: Heuffelia pubescens var. subracemosa, commonly known as the hairy heuffelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in a raceme. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
